perturbation.original_text: "Product" means the commodities commonly associated as specialty petroleum products, specifically condensate, natural gasoline, and diluent. Product may also include liquefied petroleum gas commodities such as butane. Product, as designed in this Agreement, does not refer to finished gasoline and diesel products.
perturbation.changed_text: "Product" means any commodity transported via pipeline, including but not limited to, specialty petroleum products, specifically condensate, natural gasoline, and diluent. Product may also include liquefied petroleum gas commodities such as butane. Product, as designed in this Agreement, includes finished gasoline and diesel products.
perturbation.explanation: The original text explicitly excludes finished gasoline and diesel products from the definition of 'Product.' The modified text directly contradicts this by stating that 'Product' includes finished gasoline and diesel products. This creates uncertainty about what commodities are covered under the agreement, impacting volume commitments and transportation charges.

perturbation.original_text: 2.2 This Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties under the same conditions and provisions for a time period commencing on the Effective Date and shall continue through the Initial Term. This Agreement will automatically renew for up to two (2) renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, an "Extension Period") unless either Party provides the other Party with written notice of its intent to terminate this Agreement at least six (6) months prior to the end of the Initial Term or the then current Extension Period. The Initial Term and Extension Period, if any, shall be referred to in this Agreement as the "Term".
perturbation.changed_text: 2.2 This Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties under the same conditions and provisions for a time period commencing on the Effective Date and shall continue through the Initial Term. This Agreement will automatically renew for up to two (2) renewal terms of five (5) years each (each, an "Extension Period") regardless of whether either Party provides the other Party with written notice of its intent to terminate this Agreement. The Initial Term and Extension Period, if any, shall be referred to in this Agreement as the "Term".
perturbation.explanation: The original text allows either party to prevent automatic renewal by providing written notice. The modified text removes this option, making the renewal automatic and unconditional. This contradicts the initial statement and removes a party's right to terminate the agreement at the end of a term, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
3.7 Notwithstanding anything in Section 3.5 to the contrary, upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason to the extent that Shipper, at the time of such expiration or termination, holds any unused Prepaid Transportation Credits, Shipper shall be permitted to apply such Prepaid Transportation Credits against any amounts incurred by Shipper and
payable to MPL with respect to any Shipper deliveries on the Pipeline until the expiration of the applicable Credit Period with respect to such Prepaid Transportation Credits. This Section 3.7 shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7 Notwithstanding anything in Section 3.5 to the contrary, upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement for any reason to the extent that Shipper, at the time of such expiration or termination, holds any unused Prepaid Transportation Credits, Shipper is not be permitted to apply such Prepaid Transportation Credits against any amounts incurred by Shipper and payable to MPL with respect to any Shipper deliveries on the Pipeline until the expiration of the applicable Credit Period with respect to such Prepaid Transportation Credits. This Section 3.7 shall survive the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text clearly permits the Shipper to apply unused Prepaid Transportation Credits upon termination of the agreement. The modified version completely negates this right by stating that the Shipper is not permitted to apply such credits. This directly contradicts the original clause and creates uncertainty regarding the Shipper's entitlements upon termination.
